job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience

  • 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles
  • Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation
  • Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control
  • Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly
  • Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes
  • Experience with project management systems and documentation tools
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel
  • Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com
summary: Translates business needs into structured documentation for software development. Ensures clarity, traceability, and alignment across requirements artifacts.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role. It is not a screen updater role. It is not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modeling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviors, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviors, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role focused on functional modeling, system reasoning, and requirement clarity to drive aligned development. Requires 4+ years of experience with SaaS, API, and BRD/FRD/SRS expertise.

job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

Company Overview We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead our cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment.

Role Overview This role is responsible for strengthening 2Base’s security posture, modernizing pipelines, and guiding the team toward a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities - Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments. - Conduct security risk assessments, perform vulnerability scans, coordinate penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans. - Architect, maintain, and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints. - Promote a "Security First" culture across engineering, ensuring secure design and development practices. - Monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies. - Develop and mature Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and other automation frameworks. - Design and lead secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments. - Build, operate, and secure containerized environments using Docker and Kubernetes with enforced security baselines. - Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and application layers. - Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads. - Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence. - Lead technical strategy, decision-making, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution. - Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery goals.

Required Skills & Experience - 4–8 years in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure. - Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions). - Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms with secure architecture focus. - Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible). - Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments. - Strong networking knowledge (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers). - Familiarity with security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks). - Experience with monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM). - Scripting skills in Python, Bash, Shell. - Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities. - Strong communication and collaboration skills to influence engineering teams.

Contact If this aligns with your career goals, share your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead DevSecOps practices to secure cloud infrastructure and CI/CD pipelines, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure scalable, compliant, and future-ready systems.

company: Classic Technologies & Business Solutions Pvt. Ltd.
job_description:
Software Architect

The Company CTeBS, a subsidiary of Classic Fashion, is a leading software solution provider to the apparel manufacturing industry globally. Our suite of enterprise-level products, including our flagship Trendz CMP, leverages cutting-edge technology to enhance productivity, quality, and efficiency, ensuring our clients achieve unparalleled growth and success. Our journey with Classic Fashion has uniquely positioned us to design technology-enabled products and solutions for the ever-evolving needs of the apparel manufacturing sector, and we are poised for an exciting phase of growth.

Job Summary We are looking for a hands-on Software Architect who is passionate about building scalable, high-performance software. In this role, you will serve as the bridge between high-level architectural vision and low-level code implementation. Unlike a pure manager, you will remain deeply involved in the code. You will own the technical design for major features, enforce coding standards, and solve the complex problems that stall development teams. You will work closely with the Associate Technical Manager (who handles delivery/metrics) while you ensure the technical integrity of the solution.

Responsibilities - Take full architectural responsibility for specific products or core modules (e.g., the Production Planning Engine or Payroll Calculation System). - Translate business requirements into technical design documents (TDDs), defining data models, API contracts, and class structures before coding begins. - Proactively identify "spaghetti code" or technical debt in our legacy Java/MSSQL systems and design safe refactoring plans to modernize them. - Be the final approver for critical code merges. You do not just check for bugs; you check for maintainability, security, and scalability. - Deep dive into database execution plans (Oracle/MSSQL) and application logic to optimize slow queries and reduce latency. - Enforce consistent design patterns (Singleton, Factory, Observer, etc.) across the development team to ensure the codebase remains uniform. - Act as the "Problem Solver in Chief" for the development team. When a developer is stuck on a complex logic issue, you provide the solution. - Mentor Senior Developers on how to write clean, efficient, and testable code. Conduct technical workshops on new frameworks or best practices.

Qualifications - 8 to 12 years of software development experience, with at least 2+ years in a Software Architect Role. - Expert in Java/J2EE (Spring, Hibernate, Multithreading). - Strong proficiency in MSSQL or Oracle (Stored Procedures, Indexing, Partitioning). - Solid understanding of Angular component architecture (even if you don't write CSS daily, you understand the data flow). - Strong grasp of Object-Oriented Design (OOD), Microservices patterns, and RESTful API design. - Experience with CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins/GitLab), Docker, and code quality tools (SonarQube). - Proven ability to debug complex production issues (memory leaks, thread deadlocks) under pressure.

Contact Information If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@ctebs.com.
summary: Hands-on Software Architect with 8-12 years experience in Java, MSSQL/Oracle, and Angular, leading technical design and mentoring teams.

AI Platform Engineering - Build centralized AI services for multi-app use. - Design secure APIs between AI services and backend systems. - Ensure scalability for multi-tenant SaaS environments. - Optimize AI performance and cost.

Security & Governance - Ensure data privacy and secure AI usage. - Design AI workflows for on-prem enterprise deployments. - Implement responsible AI practices and auditability.

Cross-Team Collaboration - Collaborate with product managers, developers, and leadership. - Mentor teams on AI integration. - Translate business problems into AI solutions.

What Makes This Role Unique

You will architect AI for an entire product ecosystem impacting: - Finance & ERP - Meal Prep Automation - Customer Management - Real Estate & Operations

This is a company-wide AI leadership position, not a single-project role.

Preferred Skills

Technical Skills - AI/ML architecture expertise. - LLM integration (OpenAI, Gemini). - Python (ML pipelines), Node.js, REST APIs/microservices. - Vector databases (pgvector, Qdrant), RDBMS (PostgreSQL), NoSQL (MongoDB), embeddings/RAG.

Machine Learning - XGBoost/LightGBM, forecasting models (Prophet, ARIMA), recommendation systems. - Model evaluation and deployment.

Architecture & Systems - Cloud/on-prem deployment, distributed systems, scalable architecture, API-first design.
